This bug cannot be stably reproduced even in the environment of bug reporter. We temporarily keep it in the bugzilla rather than mark it as duplicated to make it a reminder for us in case that the problem can be reproduced in future test.
This can be stable reproduce when you extract BIRT all-in-one package and open BIRT for the first time.

Still cannot stably reproduce the bug. QA engineers are working on the reproduction of the bug.

The work around to the bug is to clear the workspace setting. The bug should relate to the legacy workspace used by QA engineer.

The bug can be stably repeated by using attached work bench. The reproduction step is followed:
1.Create a new data set use "data source", which is a derby data source.
2.Create an xml data set use "data source1", which is a xml data source.

Please note that before trying to reproduce the bug we should fix the xml file reference in report design.

The exception will by then thrown.

The source of problem is that, when new a derby data set, the Thread context classloader will be set to the one which load Derby data set. However that class loader do not have xerces packages in its classpath so that cannot load class SaxParser in xml driver.

Add the code so that when we fail to load SaxParser from Thread context classloader we simply try to load it use current classloader by calling Class.forName(). The problem is so that resolved.
